module.description:
AUX Time To Digital Converter (AUX_TDC) is used to measure the time between two events with high resolution.
AUX_TDC consists of a state machine that operates at AUX bus rate and an asynchronous fast-counter which is clocked by the TDC clock. DDI_0_OSC:CTL0.ACLK_TDC_SRC_SEL configures TDC clock source. The fast-counter counts on both edges of the TDC clock to double the resolution.
See the Technical Reference Manual for event timing requirements.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
TDC commands.

bitenum.token:
Force TDC state machine back to IDLE state.
Never write this command while AUX_TDC:STAT.STATE equals CLR_CNT or WAIT_CLR_CNT_DONE.
bitenum.description:
Force TDC state machine back to IDLE state.
Never write this command while AUX_TDC:STAT.STATE equals CLR_CNT or WAIT_CLR_CNT_DONE.

bitenum.token:
Asynchronous counter start.
The counter starts to count when the start event is high. To achieve precise edge-to-edge measurements you must ensure that the start event is low for at least 420 ns after you write this command.
bitenum.description:
Asynchronous counter start.
The counter starts to count when the start event is high. To achieve precise edge-to-edge measurements you must ensure that the start event is low for at least 420 ns after you write this command.

bitenum.token:
Synchronous counter start.
The counter looks for the opposite edge of the selected start event before it starts to count when the selected edge occurs. This guarantees an edge-triggered start and is recommended for frequency measurements.
bitenum.description:
Synchronous counter start.
The counter looks for the opposite edge of the selected start event before it starts to count when the selected edge occurs. This guarantees an edge-triggered start and is recommended for frequency measurements.

bitenum.token:
Clear STAT.SAT, STAT.DONE, and RESULT.VALUE.
This is not needed as prerequisite for a measurement. Reliable clear is only guaranteed from IDLE state.
bitenum.description:
Clear STAT.SAT, STAT.DONE, and RESULT.VALUE.
This is not needed as prerequisite for a measurement. Reliable clear is only guaranteed from IDLE state.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

TDC measurement saturation flag.
0: Conversion has not saturated. 1: Conversion stopped due to saturation.
This field is cleared when a new measurement is started or when CLR_RESULT is written to CTL.CMD.

TDC measurement complete flag.
0: TDC measurement has not yet completed. 1: TDC measurement has completed.
This field clears when a new TDC measurement starts or when you write CLR_RESULT to CTL.CMD.
TDC state machine status.

bitenum.token: Current state is TDC_FORCESTOP. You wrote ABORT to CTL.CMD to abort the TDC measurement.
bitenum.description: Current state is TDC_FORCESTOP. You wrote ABORT to CTL.CMD to abort the TDC measurement.

bitenum.token: Current state is TDC_WAIT_STARTFALL. The fast-counter circuit waits for a falling edge on the start event.
bitenum.description: Current state is TDC_WAIT_STARTFALL. The fast-counter circuit waits for a falling edge on the start event.

bitenum.token: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_CLRCNT_DONE. The state machine waits for fast-counter circuit to finish reset.
bitenum.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_CLRCNT_DONE. The state machine waits for fast-counter circuit to finish reset.

bitenum.token: Current state is TDC_STATE_POR. This is the reset state.
bitenum.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_POR. This is the reset state.

bitenum.token: Current state is TDC_STATE_GETRESULTS. The state machine copies the counter value from the fast-counter circuit.
bitenum.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_GETRESULTS. The state machine copies the counter value from the fast-counter circuit.

bitenum.token: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_STOPCNTDOWN. The fast-counter circuit looks for the stop condition. It will ignore a number of stop events configured in TRIGCNTLOAD.CNT.
bitenum.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_STOPCNTDOWN. The fast-counter circuit looks for the stop condition. It will ignore a number of stop events configured in TRIGCNTLOAD.CNT.

bitenum.token: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_STOP. The state machine waits for the fast-counter circuit to stop.
bitenum.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_STOP. The state machine waits for the fast-counter circuit to stop.

bitenum.token: Current state is TDC_STATE_CLRCNT. The fast-counter circuit is reset.
bitenum.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_CLRCNT. The fast-counter circuit is reset.

bitenum.token: Current state is TDC_STATE_IDLE. This is the default state after reset and abortion. State will change when you write CTL.CMD to either RUN_SYNC_START or RUN.
bitenum.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_IDLE. This is the default state after reset and abortion. State will change when you write CTL.CMD to either RUN_SYNC_START or RUN.

bitenum.token: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_STARTSTOPCNTEN. The fast-counter circuit looks for the start condition. The state machine waits for the fast-counter to increment.
bitenum.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_STARTSTOPCNTEN. The fast-counter circuit looks for the start condition. The state machine waits for the fast-counter to increment.

bitenum.token: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_START. The fast-counter circuit looks for the start condition. The state machine waits for the fast-counter to increment.
bitenum.description: Current state is TDC_STATE_WAIT_START. The fast-counter circuit looks for the start condition. The state machine waits for the fast-counter to increment.

register.description:
Result
Result of last TDC conversion.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

TDC conversion result.
The result of the TDC conversion is given in number of clock edges of the clock source selected in DDI_0_OSC:CTL0.ACLK_TDC_SRC_SEL. Both rising and falling edges are counted.
If TDC counter saturates, VALUE is slightly higher than SATCFG.LIMIT, as it takes a non-zero time to stop the measurement. Hence, the maximum value of this field becomes slightly higher than 2^24 if you configure SATCFG.LIMIT to R24.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Saturation limit.
The flag STAT.SAT is set when the TDC counter saturates.
Values not enumerated are not supported

bitenum.token: Result bit 24: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[24] is set.
bitenum.description: Result bit 24: TDC conversion saturates and stops when RESULT.VALUE[24] is set.

register.description:
Trigger Source
Select source and polarity for TDC start and stop events. See the Technical Reference Manual for event timing requirements.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Polarity of stop source.
Change only while STAT.STATE is IDLE.

bitenum.token: TDC conversion stops when low level is detected.
bitenum.description: TDC conversion stops when low level is detected.

bitenum.token: TDC conversion stops when high level is detected.
bitenum.description: TDC conversion stops when high level is detected.

bitfield.description:
Select stop source from the asynchronous AUX event bus.
Change only while STAT.STATE is IDLE.

bitenum.token: Select TDC Prescaler event which is generated by configuration of PRECTL.
bitenum.description: Select TDC Prescaler event which is generated by configuration of PRECTL.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Polarity of start source.
Change only while STAT.STATE is IDLE.

bitenum.token: TDC conversion starts when low level is detected.
bitenum.description: TDC conversion starts when low level is detected.

bitenum.token: TDC conversion starts when high level is detected.
bitenum.description: TDC conversion starts when high level is detected.

bitfield.description:
Select start source from the asynchronous AUX event bus.
Change only while STAT.STATE is IDLE.

bitenum.token: Select TDC Prescaler event which is generated by configuration of PRECTL.
bitenum.description: Select TDC Prescaler event which is generated by configuration of PRECTL.

register.description:
Trigger Counter
Stop-counter control and status.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Number of stop events to ignore when AUX_TDC:TRIGCNTCFG.EN is 1.
Read CNT to get the remaining number of stop events to ignore during a TDC measurement.
Write CNT to update the remaining number of stop events to ignore during a TDC measurement. The TDC measurement ignores updates of CNT if there are no more stop events left to ignore.
When AUX_TDC:TRIGCNTCFG.EN is 1, TRIGCNTLOAD.CNT is loaded into CNT at the start of the measurement.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Number of stop events to ignore when AUX_TDC:TRIGCNTCFG.EN is 1.
To measure frequency of an event source: - Set start event equal to stop event. - Set CNT to number of periods to measure. Both 0 and 1 values measures a single event source period.
To measure pulse width of an event source: - Set start event source equal to stop event source. - Select different polarity for start and stop event. - Set CNT to 0.
To measure time from the start event to the Nth stop event when N > 1: - Select different start and stop event source. - Set CNT to (N-1).
See the Technical Reference Manual for event timing requirements.
When AUX_TDC:TRIGCNTCFG.EN is 1, CNT is loaded into TRIGCNT.CNT at the start of the measurement.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Enable stop-counter.
0: Disable stop-counter. 1: Enable stop-counter.
Change only while STAT.STATE is IDLE.

register.description:
Prescaler Control
The prescaler can be used to count events that are faster than the AUX bus rate. It can be used to: - count pulses on a specified event from the asynchronous event bus. - prescale a specified event from the asynchronous event bus.
To use the prescaler output as an event source in TDC measurements you must set both TRIGSRC.START_SRC and TRIGSRC.STOP_SRC to AUX_TDC_PRE.
It is recommended to use the prescaler when the signal frequency to measure exceeds 1/10th of the AUX bus rate.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Prescaler reset.
0: Reset prescaler. 1: Release reset of prescaler.
AUX_TDC_PRE event becomes 0 when you reset the prescaler.

Prescaler ratio.
This controls how often the AUX_TDC_PRE event is generated by the prescaler.

bitenum.token:
Prescaler divides input by 64.
AUX_TDC_PRE event has a rising edge for every 64 rising edges of the input. AUX_TDC_PRE event toggles on every 32nd rising edge of the input.
bitenum.description:
Prescaler divides input by 64.
AUX_TDC_PRE event has a rising edge for every 64 rising edges of the input. AUX_TDC_PRE event toggles on every 32nd rising edge of the input.

bitenum.token:
Prescaler divides input by 16.
AUX_TDC_PRE event has a rising edge for every 16 rising edges of the input. AUX_TDC_PRE event toggles on every 8th rising edge of the input.
bitenum.description:
Prescaler divides input by 16.
AUX_TDC_PRE event has a rising edge for every 16 rising edges of the input. AUX_TDC_PRE event toggles on every 8th rising edge of the input.

bitfield.description:
Prescaler event source.
Select an event from the asynchronous AUX event bus to connect to the prescaler input.
Configure only while RESET_N is 0.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Prescaler counter value.
Write a value to CNT to capture the value of the 16-bit prescaler counter into CNT. Read CNT to get the captured value.
The read value gets 1 LSB uncertainty if the event source level rises when you release the reset. The read value gets 1 LSB uncertainty if the event source level rises when you capture the prescaler counter.
Please note the following: - The prescaler counter is reset to 2 by PRECTL.RESET_N. - The captured value is 2 when the number of rising edges on prescaler input is less than 3. Otherwise, captured value equals number of event pulses - 1.
